DOC.brief_summary: The effectiveness of a mindfulness walking program is tested in subjects with a high level of subjectively perceived stress.
DOC.criteria: Healthy men and women between 18 and 65 years Increased level of stress (visual analog scale >40 mm (0100)) Regular walking training in the last 6 weeks Medical therapy with psychopharmacological drugs Regular mindfulness based meditations/exercises in the last 6 weeks CAM therapies against stress in the last 6 weeks medium or severe chronic diseases Stress due to chronic diseases Acute disease at inclusion Not being able to walk
